message: THE OUTSIDE
AAAAAAAAAAAAA. CHAMPIONS TROPHY CHAMPS LET’S GOOOOOOO.
This is the energy I want. This is the energy we deserve.
Bro, I was manifesting that last over. I KNEW Jadeja would hit the winning runs.
Oh, so now you believe in stats AND astrology?
Manifestation isn’t astrology. It’s just me bending reality to my will.
You’re saying you made Jadeja win the match. From your couch. In your pajamas.
Yes. And?
I admire the confidence.
Let’s be real, though. Rohit Sharma set the whole thing up. That 76? Clutch.
Ugh, true. But KL Rahul’s patience also saved us. We needed that stability.
Wow, look at this. India uniting over cricket. This is the only time we all agree on something.
That’s because cricket is the real national language.
LMAO. True. No one fights over cricket the way they fight over actual languages.
Oh, just wait. Give it five seconds.
What now?
Tamil Nadu vs. BJP. Language war, round 2839.
Oh boy. What happened this time?
CM Stalin basically said BJP pushing Hindi on Tamil Nadu is like a kid trying to tutor a PhD holder.
Damn. He didn’t even try to be subtle.
That’s a ridiculous comparison. Knowing multiple languages is objectively beneficial.
But why force Hindi? Tamil Nadu literally has one of the best education systems.
So? This isn’t about Tamil Nadu’s ranking. It’s about national integration.
Harshit. Dude. You can integrate without erasing linguistic identity.
No one’s erasing anything! Hindi is just the most widely spoken language in India.
And Tamil is older than Sanskrit, bro. They’re protecting something deep, not being stubborn.
Both of you make points. But let’s be real, this is also about political posturing.
Of course. But doesn’t mean Tamil Nadu is wrong for pushing back.
They could at least acknowledge that knowing Hindi is useful. Refusing it entirely is extreme.
They’re refusing because of history. It’s not just about ‘usefulness.’ It’s about control.
History is important, sure. But clinging to old wounds doesn’t help the future.
You say that like language isn’t tied to identity. It’s not just ‘old wounds,’ it’s survival.
Fun fact: The last time people tried enforcing Hindi, Tamil Nadu literally protested for months.
Yep. The anti-Hindi agitation of the 60s was massive.
Exactly. It’s not paranoia if it’s happened before.
Okay, but should the solution be rejecting Hindi entirely? That feels extreme.
Maybe it’s not about rejecting Hindi, but rejecting imposition.
THANK YOU. Someone gets it.
Okay, but let’s not pretend this is purely about language. It’s also political.
Of course it is. But that doesn’t mean the resistance isn’t valid.
Fine. But at some point, we have to move forward.
Fine. Let’s talk about Karnataka’s budget. Or as I like to call it: ‘How to Spend Billions on the Wrong Things.’
Oh boy. You sound fun today.
It’s just—okay. Look. They’re spending thousands of crores on ‘development,’ right? More metros, flyovers, a tunnel under MG Road.
Oh, that tunnel is gonna be crazy though. Like, futuristic sci-fi movie vibes.
Yeah, yeah, sure. But let’s talk about the schools where kids don’t have desks. The hospitals that are one power cut away from disaster.
Oof. You’re talking about the 70% of budget going to ‘infrastructure’ while public services crumble?
EXACTLY. They love spending money on things you can take aesthetic drone shots of. No one wants to invest in the invisible stuff.
To be fair, infrastructure is long-term. Better roads, better economy.
And what, people just suffer in the meantime? 'Hang in there, you’ll get a cool tunnel in 2035'?
Damn. Who hurt you?
You wanna know? Okay. My uncle—he worked in a government hospital for **years.** Understaffed, underpaid, the AC barely worked in the ICU.
Wait, I didn’t know that.
Yeah, well. He believed in public healthcare. Thought it should be for everyone. Then one day, he needed treatment himself.
Oh.
Machines weren’t working. Shortage of staff. By the time they transferred him to a private hospital, it was too late.
Kunal—
So yeah. Build your tunnels. Make your metro ads. But don’t act like ‘development’ is happening while people DIE waiting for real investment.
That’s… messed up. I’m sorry.
Whatever. Let’s move on. What’s next? China-India drama?
Uh. Yeah. Apparently, there’s tension over trade deals and border security again.
Classic. Power plays, trust issues, empty statements. The usual.
Kinda like this chat right now.
What’s that supposed to mean?
Just… you always have something to say. But it’s never this.
Yeah, well. No one’s here for a TED Talk on my personal life.
Maybe we are. Maybe you don’t always have to entertain us, Kunal.
Hey. We don’t have to keep talking. We can just… sit with it for a sec.
Yeah.
You guys are so weird. I just yelled about budgets, and now it’s therapy hour?
Words matter. You use them to keep things light. But today, you didn’t.
And that’s okay.
...You’re all so annoying. I hate this.
I know.
So, uh. China-India relations. Who’s got takes?
Honestly? Kinda feels small now.
It’s not small. It’s just… not the real conversation anymore.
Yeah. Maybe for once, we don’t need to have a take.
Wow. Kunal without a take. Somebody write this down.
Shut up.
FIN
